name: Prince
description:
'''Prince Rogers Nelson''' (June 7, 1958{{spnd}}April 21, 2016), known mononymously as '''Prince''', was an American singer, songwriter, musician, and actor. Prince is often credited as an influence on modern [[popular music]] and one of the greatest musicians of his era, pioneering the [[Minneapolis sound]] and being instrumental to the evolution of various other genres of music.   

Born and raised in [[Minneapolis]], [[Minnesota]], Prince signed a record deal with [[Warner Records|Warner Bros. Records]] at the age of 18, releasing his first album [[For You (Prince album)|For You]] two years later. He went on to achieve critical success with his albums ''[[Dirty Mind]]'' (1980), ''[[Controversy (Prince album)|Controversy]]'' (1981), and ''[[1999 (Prince album)|1999]]'' (1982). In 1984, Prince became the first singer to simultaneously have a number-one film, album and single in the US, with the film ''[[Purple Rain (film)|Purple Rain]]'', [[Purple Rain (album)|its soundtrack]], and "[[When Doves Cry]]", which was the [[Billboard Year-End Hot 100 singles of 1984|biggest hit single of the year]]. The album, recorded with his new backing band [[The Revolution (band)|the Revolution]], spent [[Billboard 200#Most weeks at No. 1|six consecutive months]] atop the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart and won the [[Academy Award for Best Original Score|Academy Award for Best Original Song Score]]. After disbanding the Revolution, Prince released his first [[Double album|double LP]], ''[[Sign o' the Times]]'' (1987), widely lauded by critics as the greatest work of his career and one of the greatest records in popular music history.

In 1993, in the midst of a contractual dispute with [[Warner Bros.|Warner Bros]], Prince changed his stage name to the unpronounceable symbol , known to fans as the "'''Love Symbol'''".{{efn|During this time, Prince was also often referred to as The Artist Formerly Known as Prince, abbreviated as TAFKAP, or simply The Artist.}} After signing a contract with [[Arista Records]] in 1998, Prince reverted to his original name in 2000 and continued releasing albums, including the double [[Grammy Awards|Grammy Award]] winning [[Musicology (album)|''Musicology'']] (2004). He was a prolific musician who released [[Prince albums discography|39 albums]] during his life, with [[Unreleased Prince projects|a vast array of unreleased material]]. On April 21, 2016, at the age of 57, Prince died after accidentally overdosing on laced [[fentanyl]] in counterfeit [[hydrocodone/paracetamol]] pills at his [[Paisley Park]] home and recording studio in [[Chanhassen, Minnesota]]. 

Prince has sold more than 100 million records worldwide, making him one of the [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling music artists of all time]]. [[List of awards and nominations received by Prince|His awards]] include the [[Grammy Awards|Grammy]] [[28th Annual Grammy Awards#Special awards|President's Merit Award]], the [[American Music Award for Achievement|American Music Awards for Achievement]] and [[American Music Award of Merit|of Merit]], the [[Billboard Icon Award|''Billboard'' Icon Award]], an [[Academy Awards|Academy Award]], and a [[Golden Globe Awards|Golden Globe Award]]. He was inducted into the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]] in 2004, the [[National Rhythm & Blues Hall of Fame|Rhythm and Blues Music Hall of Fame]] in 2016, the [[Songwriters Hall of Fame]] in 2024, and twice into the [[Black Music & Entertainment Walk of Fame]] in 2022.
